body.p: A cluster is a single Hadoop environment attached to a pair of distribution switches providing an aggregation layer for the entire cluster. A cluster can range in size from a single rack to a set of pods. A cluster shares the infrastructure nodes and management tools for operating the Hadoop environment. The size of the cluster can vary depending on the capacity of the aggregation network. For example, a Dell Force10 Z9000 aggregation switch can run a larger cluster than the Dell Force10 S4810 switches.
